entry.title: The Modern Java Web Developer
entry.content:
I’ve decided to make some notes regarding Matt Raible presentations:
  • http://www.slideshare.net/mraible/the-modern-java-web-developer-denver-jug-2013
  • http://www.slideshare.net/mraible/comparing-jvm-web-frameworks-devoxx-france-2013


Now, I restrict my language set to: Java and JavaScript. There are huge hype around Scala/Play (was Ruby/Rails).
This decision is based on the local job market.

So, the modern Java Web developer should have skills in the next areas:
  • Concepts:
    • High performance web site
    • Security consideration
    • Web for Mobile devices
    • Cloud base deployment
    • Caching
    • Page Speed
    • RESTful Architecture
    • Clustering
  • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, LESS
  • jQuery, jQuery UI
  • Twitter Bootstrap
  • FireBug, Chrome DevTools (http://www.igvita.com/slides/2012/devtools-tips-and-tricks/#1)
  • IDE: STS, Intellij IDEA
  • Spring, Hibernate/JPA, Spring Data, Servlet 3
  • Jackson (for JSON)
  • nginx(static content provider, load balancer)
  • wro4j (http://code.google.com/p/wro4j/)
  • WebJars (http://www.webjars.org/)
  • Frameworks:
    • Full Stack Frameworks
      • Spring Roo
      • JBoss Forge
    • API Frameworks
      • Jersey
      • RESTEasy
      • Apache CXF
      • Dropwizard
    • JavaScript MVC Framework (see http://codebrief.com/2012/01/the-top-10-javascript-mvc-frameworks-reviewed/):
      • Backbone.js
      • Angular.js
      • Ember.js
      • Knockout.js
    • Pure JVM Web Framewroks
      • JSF (Primefaces)
      • Spring MVC
  • Document REST API
    • enunciate (http://enunciate.codehaus.org/)
    • swagger (https://developers.helloreverb.com/swagger/)
Avoid languages which compile to JavaScript:
  • CoffeeScript
  • TypeScript
  • Dart
